subject: Re: assertEquals
msgSnippet: I have tried without reload class it does not make any difference. I have tested the code outside JUnit and got the same. So I still think JUnit is clear on
messageBody:
I have tried without reload class it does not make any difference.
I have tested the code outside JUnit and got the same. So I still
think JUnit is clear on that one ;-)

Benjamin
--- In junit@y..., "Pritchard, Sean" <sean.pritchard@n...> wrote:
> It is possible that you have a classloader problem. The
classloader is
> "secretly" prepended to the fully qualified class name of an
object. This
> will generally result in an instaceof call returning false. Most
> object.equals() methods first do an instance of check and return
false if
> the objects are not of the same class type.
> We have had cases where a JUnit test puts an object on a JMS
message
> queue, then retrieves it and check it for equality. This test
fails when
> JUnit's class reloading is turned on, but succeeds when class
reloading is
> disabled.
>
> Sean
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: benjamin@h...
> [mailto:benjamin@h...]
> Sent: Tuesday, October 23, 2001 9:54 AM
> To: junit@y...
> Subject: [junit] Re: assertEquals
>
>
> The message is absolutly right.
> copying again from an other run:
>
> junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Wrong country
> expected:<com.notuskey.persistence.whoWhere.CountryPK@e0> but
> was:<com.notuskey.persistence.whoWhere.CountryPK@e0>
>
> I don't think it is coming from JUnit though. If I do the following:
>
> System.out.println(aCountry.isIdentical(aJurisdiction.getCountry
()));
>
> I got a "false".
> The following:
> System.out.println(aCountry+ " "+aJurisdiction.getCountry());
>
> I got:
> ethenticate/Country:com.notuskey.persistence.whoWhere.CountryPK@e0
> ethenticate/Country:com.notuskey.persistence.whoWhere.CountryPK@e0
>
> I wonder if JBoss is not to blame. I'll send them a mail
>
> --- In junit@y..., Jason Rogers <jacaetev@y...> wrote:
> > This seems highly unlikely. Two objects pointing to the same
> reference are
> > absolutely equal. Are you sure you copied the message properly?
> >
> > -jason
> >
> > --- benjamin@h... wrote:
> > > Hello,
> > > I am testing a EJB with an assertEquals and I get the following:
> > >
> > > junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Wrong country
> > >
>
expected:<ethenticate/Country:com.notuskey.persistence.whoWhere.Countr
> > > yPK@e0> but
> > >
>
was:<ethenticate/Country:com.notuskey.persistence.whoWhere.CountryPK@e
> > > 0>
> > >
> > > which puzzles me, because it looks like they are equal. But I
am
> new
> > > to JUnit and I might not get it.
> > >
> > > Thank you,
> > > Benjamin
